csf_name: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated
recommendation: Define and document security responsibilities and enforcement processes.
Ensure contracts with suppliers include security and risk requirements.
Document and communicate security roles, responsibilities, and authorities.

csf_name: Risk management activities are reviewed and adjusted based on exercises or incidents.
recommendation: Incorporate post-incident reviews and tabletop exercise outcomes to refine risk management controls and procedures.
Maintain an up-to-date asset inventory including devices, VMs, and containers.

csf_name: Baseline of operations/data flows established & managed
recommendation: Establish and maintain an up-to-date baseline of operations and data flows to detect and manage anomalies effectively.
Maintain a list of all external vendors, cloud services, and third-party tools.

csf_name: Resources are prioritized based on classification, criticality, and business value.
recommendation: Classify assets by criticality and apply appropriate protection levels.
Schedule regular internal/external vulnerability scans and track remediation.
Enforce strong password policies and implement MFA.
Use strong, multi-factor authentication to verify all users, services, and devices before granting access.
Use full-disk encryption or encrypted file systems.
Implement file integrity monitoring and version control.

csf_name: Communications and control networks are protected
recommendation: Disable insecure protocols and enforce TLS 1.2+.

csf_name: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
recommendation: Implement network monitoring tools to detect anomalies and potential cybersecurity events.

csf_name: Monitoring for unauthorized changes in external systems is performed
recommendation: Monitor and detect unauthorized changes in external systems.
Create and rehearse a documented incident response plan.

csf_name: Public relations are managed during incidents
recommendation: Prepare public statements and designate a PR spokesperson.

csf_name: Incident response information is shared with stakeholders.
recommendation: Establish clear communication channels to promptly share incident details with internal teams and external partners
Contain threats immediately using playbooks and escalation procedures.
Immediately and conduct documented post-mortems.
Test backups and rehearse system restoration procedures.

csf_name: Recovery policies and procedures established and maintained
recommendation: Document findings from incidents and integrate them into recovery plans.

csf_name: Integrity of restored assets verified; systems/services restored; normal ops confirmed
recommendation: Verify restored systems and data integrity before returning to normal operations.

csf_name: Share recovery status and progress updates with key internal and external stakeholders.
recommendation: Set up a communication plan to keep stakeholders informed during recovery.
